page.title: 12Education
page.content: the school is named after Dr. Ian Ramsey, Bishop of Durham, who died on 6th October 1972.It has its origin in a Bluecoat School founded in the 18th. century which developed into Stockton Grammer School.The school is an 11-16 Aided Church of England Comprehensive School with its main intake coming from three primary schools - Bowesfield,Hartburn and Holy Trinity.Children are also addmitted by the Governors from outside the catchment area after application from parents who wish their children to be educated in a Church of England School.
